Fashion

Second-Hand City: A Thrifting Guide to York

By Eilidh Hide

Eilidh Hide helps you uncover York's hidden gems with her guide to second-hand shopping.

Fashion and the Black Lives Matter Movement

By Alex Thompson

Maya Barber takes a look at the fashion industry's response to the Black Lives Matter movement, and discuses why these responses, although sometimes problematic, are vital

The Fashion Industry: Appreciation or Appropriation?

By Alex Thompson

Zara Osako looks at the problematic relationship between race, culture and fashion

Small Businesses, Big Statements

By Zara Osaka

Zara Osako gives a collective guide to supporting small UK-based fashion businesses to suit any budget

Fashion Week: A Roundup of the Top Moments

By Sarah Gatenby-Howells

Sarah Gatenby-Howells looks at how fashion week has returned to the runway following the pandemic

Summer Spirit

By James Bithell

Happy Birthday luxury fashion brand Gucci who celebrate their 90th year as one of the best in the business. The look is retro chic plus uber bold colours. Creative Director Frida Giannini is implementing a new eco-friendly strategy to project the brand into the future (Thumbnail credit Photos: style.com)

Trends: Royal Ascot

Stephen Jones, Ascot's official milliner for 2011, has made an impact with his feathered orange and purple hat adorned with poppies, worn not by a lady but a filly (to non-equine followers that's a female horse)

The Jackson Aftershock

As the second anniversary of Michael Jackson's death approaches the sense of loss certainly does not seem to have lessened. There are stars, there are superstars and there are legends. Jackson was all of these and more

Lady in lace?

It's the versatility of lace that makes it such an enduring fashion staple. But how do we update lace in summer 2011? Amy Cooke gives you a few ideas (Thumbnail credit Taylor Momsen makes lace more casual)

Flower Power

Cliche though it may be, florals are a big yes for this summer's wardrobe. <em>Serena Kalirai</em> takes you through how to do it this time round

Trending: sunglasses

When we think of summer we think of sunglasses. When we think of designer glasses we turn to Ray-Ban. Heritage with a twist, dating back to the 1930s as binocular designers and later sunglasses specialists distributing to the US Armed forces

The Beautiful Game

Did you watch the football? It was a healthy competition, full of talented young men at a peak of physical fitness. We all remember David Beckham, Freddie Ljungberg and, my personal favourite, Didier Drogba posing in their tiny briefs, just bulging with style. Fashion and football have a relationship often overlooked

Paris Bennett

By James Bithell

On the 29th April of this year the world witnessed the birth of a potential fashion superstar. She is classy, elegant, young and very British. The gown she wore was white and she walked down the aisle of Westminster Abbey. But it's not Catherine Middleton, it's her younger sister Philippa

Let's hear it for the men

Trending: pastels

By James Bithell

A simple side of chic and sexy was achieved by Italo Zucchelli, menswear design director for Calvin Klein, in his Spring 2011 collection. He expressed a clean but muted vibe through a palate of slate grey shades, turquoise, taupe and honey

Pretty on the inside?

By James Bithell

We investigate whether perfume bottles have any reflection on the scent

Follow my lead

Who are the real style dictators? Celebrity, stylist or designer? Helena Davies investigates (Thumbnail credit Image: coco+kelley)

Decarnin leaves Balmain

By James Bithell

With Decarnin leaving Balmain Paris Bennett explores the unique psychological crises faced by fashion's greats today

Crossing the line?

The blurred line between art and pornography that Richardson is renowned for treading along is well and truly back (Thumbnail credit Image: _ankor via Flickr)

Bieber fever

A joke he may seem, Justin Bieber is now taking the fashion world by storm at the command of acclaimed designers Domenico Dolce and Stefano Gabbana. Is the 17-year-old star actually a force to be reckoned with? (Thumbnail credit Image: Beacon Radio via Flickr)

'The' dress deconstructed

By James Bithell

The thing that has topped and tailed conversation since November last year has now been revealed: Sarah Burton designed <em>that</em> dress. Paris Bennett gives her analysis of why and how it works (Thumbnail credit Image: Beacon Radio)

Humble roots

Slipping back on my TOMS after the <em>One Day Without Shoes</em> event this Tuesday, pioneered by the footwear brand made me think how we take a such a basic and everyday item for granted

Extraordinary event for ordinary people

It was an explosion of creative people joining together and working towards a common goal: to pin York on the fashion map

Alexander McQueen: a new wave of tribute

Just over a year on from the death of fashion great, Alexander McQueen, and his iconography is ever-growing. We take a look at the latest wave of tributes

That McQueen look

By James Bithell

The style set out by Alexander McQueen remains prevalent today. In this shoot we pick out the top high street looks to match it yourself

A newer, better vintage fair?

By James Bithell

York Does Vintage is a new alternative to the usual student haunt, Judy's Vintage Fair. Hannah Clugston checks out the new competitor, and likes what she sees

Riccardo Tisci confirmed as Dior chief designer

By James Bithell

The latest progression in the Galliano saga: his redundancy is confirmed, and Givenchy's Riccardo Tisci takes to the stand

London Fashion Week

"In difficult times fashion is always outrageous." Elsa Schiaparelli could very well have been talking last week, or at least far more recently than her long gone iconic era of the 1920's, as this certainly chimed in with this season's London Fashion Week (Thumbnail credit Photo: Fashion Mode)

The set designer: Rhea Thierstein

By James Bithell

Selfridges' Bright Young Thing, Rhea Thierstein, talks to Sarah Wolfe about her profession

Top Four

By James Bithell

Daniel Lismore pulses a strong beat to a fashion heart. We caught up with one of London's most fashionable to see what he had to say about the shows and who he is wearing

Catwalk

By James Bithell

Our pick of the best catwalks at this years London Fashion Week

Top Models

By James Bithell

<em>Nouse</em>'s pick of top models at London Fashion Week 2011

Fresh Fashion Faces

LFW hype centres around clothes, but models to parade them around need to be found somewhere. Sarah Wolfe talks to Milly Bee, fashion scout, about finding the right girls

The Catwalk Playlist

Nouse male model pick: James Cooper

(Thumbnail credit Image: Cecile Harris; Model: James Cooper @ D1 Models)
